bill.title: Uniform laws; enact Uniform Common Interest Ownership Act.
bill.description: An Act To Create The Uniform Common Interest Ownership Act; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide For The Applicability Of The Act; To Address Separate Titles And Taxation; To Address The Effect Of Eminent Domain And Other Supplemental Provisions Of Law; To Provide For Uniformity In The Application Of This Act; To Address Unconscionable Provisions; To Require Good Faith; To Provide For Monetary Adjustments; To Provide For Certain Exceptions; To Provide For The Applicability Of Preexisting Common Interest Communities; To Provide For Governing Instruments And Amendments Thereto; To Provide For The Applicability To Nonresidential And Mixed Use Communities; To Provide For Exempt Covenants; To Provide For The Creation Of Common Interest Communities; To Address Boundaries; To Provide For The Construction And Validity Of Declarations And Bylaws; To Provide For Leasehold Common Interest Communities; To Provide For The Allocation Of Allocated Interests; To Address Plats And Plans; To Provide For The Exercise Of Development Rights; To Provide For The Alteration Of Units; To Provide For The Reallocation Of Unit Boundaries; To Provide For Easements And Use Rights; To Allow Amendments To Declarations; To Provide For The Termination Of A Common Interest Community; To Provide For The Rights Of Secured Lenders; To Provide For Mergers And Consolidations; To Provide For The Management Of Common Interest Communities; To Provide For Unit Associations And Prescribe Their Duties And Powers; To Provide For The Governance Of Associations; To Provide For The Transfer Of Rights; To Provide For Termination; To Provide For Upkeep; To Address Meeting Quorums; To Address Liability Of Associations; To Address Conveyances And Encumberances; To Require Insurance; To Allow Assessments And Liens; To Require Record Keeping; To Provide Rule Making Authority; To Provide For The Removal Of Officers; To Address Budgeting And Litigation Issues; To Provide For The Protection Of Purchasers; To Address Warranties; To Bring Forward Sections 89-9-1 Through 89-9-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.
